The fact that this game is the highest rated on Steam should say enough.

But if that doesn't convince you go and take a look at the negative reviews, they're about 90% people who put themselves as negative just so that they can say positive things and get noticed instead of being another comment in this sea, no, OCEAN of positive reviews!

Отзывы же, касса и внезапно организовавшаяся толпа поклонников после выхода игры в свет говорили, что ни те, ни другие гики не подвели и можно начинать фигачить полновесное продолжение, но уже с блэкджеком и распутными девками.

Amazing, an absolute need to your library. With a brittish robot all the way over to a cruel-humored robot named GLaDOS. Enjoy sentry takedowns, mind-bending puzzles, weird gel puzzles, and even more than that! The story is amazing, it could not be finished in a better way. (I won't spoil of course.) IMDB (International Movie Data Base) rates this game with 9.6 stars, which is very difficult to get on a video game. When you beat the story you can continue into CO-OP, which is just as fun! I highly reccomend this game! 10/10 stars!

It's not very recent, granted, but Portal 2 is a great game. Not so complex puzzles that causes you to stop and think twice before starting a test chamber (i.e puzzle), yet not so tough that it makes you throw your keyboard (or mouse, a laptop is quite heavy) against the wall and, like the Stanley Parable's achievement, go outside and not play the game for 5 years.

The storyline is quite simple, yet it is beautifully written. You can see GLaDOS in a whole new light (not just the metallic Hal-like psychopath who wants to slaughter you and laugh at your demise) and one can appreciate the extent of Aperture Labs, perhaps even wondering about the ethical conundrums that preludes the whole corporation.

Ponder harder as you step into multiplayer and the "Perpetual Testing Initiative", a place where you can create your own test chambers and share them with the Steam community! Let your imagination run wild as you test other's test chambers while creating really wacky ones of your own. Do you want an ambush of turrets hiding around the corner, trapping the exit room door? Now you can! Do you want to create a laser grid that frys the test subject when he/she activates the wrong switch? Now you can! The sky is the limit! (Although due to limitations, one can't stack too much stuff into any one test chamber, so that is a challenge in itself!)

9.5/10 indeed. It is worth forking out the 20USD, more so when it is on sale! Own it and see for yourself!

A game that really nails the humor the entire time. Pretty nice puzzles to solve throughout the entire game. Nice callbacks to the original portal and is a very satisfying sequel. One of my favorite games of all time.

Une narration soigné, une histoire bien ficellé, un gameplay qui révolutionne celui déjà mis en place dans Portal premier du nom, une bande son dynamique et en parfaite accord avec le jeu, des doublages de très grande qualité, Un coop avant gardiste et fun... bref un incontournable ne souffrant que de son accessibilité le rendant trop simple à mes yeux.

If you don't own this we're not friends.

Honestly, Portal 2 is one of the best games you could buy on Steam. It has a fun, entertaining story with a few twists, likeable characters, and really cool puzzles to solve and areas to explore. I still replay it to this day because of those reasons, and because a Portal 3 is probably not going to happen, knowing Valve. But at this point, they would have to measure up to a ton of hype, and I'm not sure they could make a sequel better than this one.

The co-op missions are a ton of fun as well. Back when I had a PS3 I had a friend over for several days and we took the time to do all of the missions, and it was the most fun I've had with co-op in a long time. I haven't been able to do it again, but given the chance if one of my friends was willing to, I definitely would.

So basically, there isn't a single thing wrong with this game. I cannot recommend it enough. If you've never played it, you are really missing out.

Sempre olhei para esse jogo com desconfiança e até desprezo, até o dia que resolvi joga-lo, eu percebi que estava desprezando um excelente game, e poe excelente nisso, tanto o modo coop como individual lhe prende do começo ao fim.

A very fun game!  Not QUITE as difficult as the previous, but very worthwhile still.  Play as Chell in the singeplayer again with the company of "Rick" the robot, where GLaDOS returns with a vengeance.  Or play a totally separate two player campaign, as the robots P-body and Atlas.  Very fun puzzles, and the cooperative element of the two player campaign makes it even more fun.  Lots of fun to be had either way, and even more humor in this game.

I found myself in a constanst rush to finish the game, something I havn't felt in years between the tiny tidbits of script which oozed while written dialouge. Loading screens and the source engine's many failings conteracted with the games great level design. Also serves as a reminder that Valve can still make a great game.

I grew up in the circus, but I hate clowns. When I was thirteen, I hiked twenty-six miles into the dense forests of the Northern Pacific. There, I was to compete in my very first Kumite. I killed 12 men and one dog that night. I feel really bad about the dog. I had a thing for this trapeze chick, once. Her name was Jess, great kisser. Her lips tasted like cookie dough ice cream. I love cookie dough ice cream. Man, Slatkin makes a really great smelling candle. When you live a life like I do, you tend to spoil yourself.
Nothing more to say about that hasn´t been said already. Simply the best and funniest puzzlinggame in recent years.

Portal 2 is a fantastic successor to a fantastic game. The original Portal was a game that had everything it needed and nothing more, and while this made for a tight, filler-free experience from start to finish. it also failed to satisfy many people, who saw the massive potential the mechanics had and demanded more to whet their appetites. This is the game to satisfy those people. Portal 2 takes the original game's concept and runs with it, adding a ton of new ways to sove puzzles and interact with the environment, from light bridges to lasers to three types of gels, each having a unique impact on the surface it coats. While this adds variety and a greater play time, it comes at the cost of adding some flab to the slim as a whistle Portal experience, meaning that some of this game's playtime is wasted on pointless filler, something that could not be said of Portal 1. However, the advantage of this is a much greater sense of scale and ambition, making the game feel more substantial and leaving the player less hungry. It's like choosing between a small portion of a fantastic steak and a medium portion of a fantastic steak that's just a tad overdone. Which one you prefer will depend on whether you want the best experience possible of if you don't want to feel hungry at the end of the night. The story is also top-notch. The principle of more carries over here, as more characters are added and more time is spent developing the world and the characters and the plot. Again, which plot you prefer is down to personal preference, but either way you'll be getting a lot of laughs. Finally, on top of all that, this game has a fantastic co-op mode, which, unlike the single player mode, is short, sweet, and has no filler to get in the way of some of the most brilliant puzzles in the Portal canon. If you can find a friend willing and able to play, this extra alone is worth the price of admission.

Score: 9/10

It's got to be hard to make a sequel to one of the best games ever made, but Valve has done that a few times. They succeeded once again. Bravo, Valve. Co-op has to be my favorite addition. Hilarious, fun, and stimulating.
